title: GOOD | English meaning - Cambridge Dictionary
text: good adjective (PLEASANT/SATISFACTORY) - goodIt's a good film overall. - enjoyableWe had an enjoyable time with Bob and Helen. - pleasant The weather is pleasant but not too hot. - interestingThe history of the place was really interesting. - niceHave a nice day! - You'll like Rosie - she's good company. - Such a noisy environment was not conducive to a good night's sleep. - The empty roads make this area good cycling country. - The good thing about the bike is that it dismantles if you want to put it in the back of the car. - I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave. - (as) good as gold idiom - all is well idiom - at the best of times idiom - be off the hook idiom - be the last word in something idiom - better - cut - gold standard - heteronormative - high-quality - knock something into a cocked hat idiom - leave someone/something in the dust idiom - miles idiom - second - sound - super good - topper - unexcelled - unsurpassed - up your game idiom good adjective (HIGH QUALITY) - goodBuy a really good foundation and cultivate a healthy glow. - good/high qualityWe have a real commitment to high-quality ingredients. - qualityWe are working hard to produce a quality product. - fineThey have a well-stocked cellar full of fine wines. - superiorThe food and service here are superior to any other restaurant in the city. - Her work is sometimes good, but the problem is she's not consistent. - We need someone who can write good copy for our publicity department. - With a good telescope, you can see craters on the moon. - It's important for children to get a good education. - The design is so good it's sure to set the pattern for many others. - (as) good as gold idiom - all is well idiom - at the best of times idiom - righteousHe refused to stray from the righteous path. - honestHe was a hardworking, honest family man who was only trying to do his duty. - upstandingIâ€™m sure most of them are honest, upstanding members of society. - goodBe a good girl and sit quietly. - as good as goldThe babysitter said Arlo had been as good as gold. - angelTeddy is a little angel. - obedientHe always tried his best to be an obedient son. - I'll just have to take you home if you can't be good, children. -
